nodes.label: Asset bubble
nodes.description: Unsustainably overpriced assets such as commodities, housing, shares, etc. in a major economy or region.

nodes.label: Deflation
nodes.description: Prolonged ultra-low inflation or deflation in a major economy or region.

nodes.label: Failure of financial mechanism or institution
nodes.description: Prolonged ultra-low inflation or deflation in a major economy or region.

nodes.label: Failure of critical infrastructure
nodes.description: Failure to adequately invest in, upgrade and secure infrastructure networks (e.g. energy, transportation and communications) leads to pressure or a breakdown with system-wide implications.

nodes.label: Fiscal crises
nodes.description: END  Failure to adequately invest in, upgrade and secure infrastructure networks (e.g. energy, transportation and communications) leads to pressure or a breakdown with system-wide implications.

nodes.label: Ageing population
nodes.description: Ageing populations in developed and developing countries driven by declining fertility and decrease of middle and old age mortality.

nodes.label: Changing landscape of international governance
nodes.description: Changing landscape of global or regional institutions (e.g.  UN, IMF, NATO, etc.), agreements or networks.

nodes.label: Climate change
nodes.description: Change of climate which is attributed directly or indirectly to human activity that alters the composition of the global atmosphere, in addition to natural climate variability.

nodes.label: Environmental degradation
nodes.description: Deterioration in the quality of air, soil and water from ambient concentrations of pollutants and other activities and processes.

nodes.label: Growing middle class in emerging economies
nodes.description: Growing share of population reaching middle-class income levels in emerging economies.

nodes.label: Increasing national sentiment
nodes.description: Increasing national sentiment among populations and political leaders affecting countries??? national and international political positions.

nodes.label: Increasing polarization of societies
nodes.description: Inability to reach agreement on key issues within countries because of diverging or extreme values, political or religious views.

nodes.label: Rise of chronic diseases
nodes.description: Increasing rates of non-communicable diseases, also known as chronic diseases, leading to long-term costs of treatment and threatening recent societal gains in life expectancy and quality.

nodes.label: Rise of cyber dependency
nodes.description: Rise of cyber dependency due to increasing digital interconnection of people, things and organizations.

nodes.label: Rising geographic mobility
nodes.description: Increasing mobility of people and things due to quicker and better-performing means of transport and lowered regulatory barriers.

nodes.label: Rising income and wealth disparity
nodes.description: Increasing socioeconomic gap between rich and poor in major countries or regions.

nodes.label: Shifts in power
nodes.description: Shifting power from state to non-state actors and individuals, from global to regional levels, and from developed to emerging market and developing economies.

nodes.label: Urbanization
nodes.description: Rising number of people living in urban areas resulting in physical growth of cities.
